remarks: Express the predicate:  The limit of complex number sequence ` F ` is ` A ` , or ` F ` converges to ` A ` , with more general quantifier restrictions than ~ clim .  Similar to ~ clim2 , but without the disjoint var constraint ` F k ` .  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 11-Dec-2019.)
statement:
nf $e |- F/_ k F $.
clim2f.z $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
clim2f.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
clim2f.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. V ) $.
clim2f.b $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) = B ) $.
clim2f $p |- ( ph -> ( F ~~> A <-> ( A e. CC /\ A. x e. RR+ E. j e. Z A. k e. ( ZZ>= ` j ) ( B e. CC /\ ( abs ` ( B - A ) ) < x ) ) ) ) $.
$d A j k x $.
$d F j x $.
$d M j $.
$d Z j k $.
$d j k ph x $.
